search_results.snippet:
"So faithful in love and so dauntless in war  there never was a knight like young 
... worshiped Scott's chivalric vision and endlessly read every novel and poem he'
d written to give it life. Maybe that odd devotion to old Sir Walter was one of the 
clues to this ...... I know a lot of people called him a hero, but I'm hanged if I do.".

search_results.snippet:
Lochinvar - Sir Walter Scott & all Sir Walter Scott poems. O, young ... Fictional 
romantic hero of the ballad Marmion (1808) by Sir Walter Scott. .... So faithful in 
love, and so dauntless in war, There never was a knight like the young Lochinvar.
